newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish shares close lower, poised for recovery.
newsitem.headline: Danish shares close lower, poised for recovery.

text.p: Danish share prices closed lower in a quiet pre-Christmas market on Thursday, with dealers seeing gains just round the corner after Wall Street's encouraging opening.

"We could well see the KFX index climb between a quarter and a half point tomorrow because U.S. is making solid advances after the afternoon's good November inflation and retail trade data," one dealer said.
The KFX top-20 index closed 0.32 point down at 130.64 while the KFX December future fell 0.10 point to 131.00 with 216 contracts each worth 100,000 crowns traded.
Dealers saw dollar and bond sensitive paper such as Novo Nordisk, Superfos, leading banks and shipping doing particularly well on Friday in the wake of the U.S. rises.
Unidanmark and rival Den Danske Bank both ended the day one crown up at 292 and 439 respectively.

Novo had a disappointing day, shedding 30 crowns to finish at 1,090 while Superfos dropped five crowns to 705 and shipper Lauritzen lost 10 crowns to finish at 700, after Wednesday's news that it sold a 48 percent shareholding in its troubled Danyard shipyard to a Malaysian company.
